description: Mis-placed note on vocal track 1s outro messed with lyrics. Fixed
title: Something In The Way

description: Changed a great deal to bring the tab in line with the original song: Overhauled the composition to fix the issue with having to switch BPM for verse/chorus by rewriting the song in its native 105BPM(wouldn't have to do this if Songsterr allowed you to write in double/half-time; as it stands you cant accurately halve 105BPM). This should help with keeping the beat for you drummers, as well as general readability while learning. No more ugly 2/4 time signature mid song. Added the correct closed repeat to the beginning to help reduce the measure count of our nearly doubled count. Its actually about x1.9 without the repeat because 1.5 BPM matters that much to 51 measures. Re-implemented the correct ghost notation because while it might be drowned out in the full composition, the song was originally just an solo-acoustic/vocals arrangement. Adjusted both vocal tracks in preparation to adding lyrics. And finally added said lyrics, which shouldn't be offset; if they are: I will fix them.
title: Something In The Way

description:
Cole Jensen.
1) 1-st verse tempo was wrong, you're right.
2) 2-nd verse tempo is 50, you're not right.
3) 35bar guitartrack. Do you think the second hit on the strings is a   

   complete chord of three notes? I think you're wrong in this place.
4) Did you delete time over the track to make it harder to navigate?
   I thinks it's wrong decision.
5) 16bar drumtrack. Last note is Bass drum (BD). Why did you delete it?
   49 bar drumtrack.Not two different toms, just double low tom LT.
   It is easier to read the tab when the bass drum is below, the snare  

   in the middle, the cymbals on above. But you mixed everything up.
   Maybe I didnâ€™t find all your mistakes.

Total: You did more bad than good. Therefore, I return my tab.

Aslo i have added Back voice.
title: Something In The Way
